About

I graduated with a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science with honors in May 2018 from the University of Texas at Austin. I am currently working as a software engineer for Capital One.

Some of my passions are serving God, rock climbing, country two stepping, and using my code to make life easier. I love pentesting, finding solutions with AWS, and writing software.

Around the Web

Credits

Pintos

Built mini operating system to include priority scheduling, argument passing on the stack, system calls for user programs, virtual memory, and converted the existing single-thread file system into a multi-threaded, multi-indexed file system.

  • Date: Spring 2016
  • Service: Computer Architecture

Challengeapp

Built performance pipeline through Spinnaker, helped monitor resources through Splunk and designed tests for the UI and APIs used for customer facing web app using Ruby on Rails.

  • Date: Fall 2018
  • Service: Web Development

Userdata Dashboard

Dashboard to identify bad user practices across EC2 instances at Capital One. Utilized Elasticsearch to pull userdata quickly through a Flask API to a user interface and designed for easy deployment and reliability using both Docker and AWS.

  • Date: May 2017
  • Service: Web Development

Dinetexas

IOS app built to help students find locations to eat on campus at The University of Texas at Austin. Built using Firebase to store user data and display important information such as wait times and ratings that will help make decisions easier when looking for places to eat .

  • Date: Spring 2017
  • Service: App Development

Aes

Advanced Encryption Standard, which was coded from scratch for 256 bit keys. Designed a cryptography system based on AES encryption. Fully incorporated each of the steps of AES for 256 bit keys. Encrypts at an average rate of 15 MB/s.

  • Date: Fall 2016
  • Service: Security
